page.title: 02EDUCATION
page.content:
The main feature of this area is farm land,but in the northern sector lies{ {Cleeve Comprehensive School}some housing and Folly Farm Nurseries. The Honeybourne railway line makes a pleasant footpath leading north and south.The present map mentions a small sewage farm, but according to our investigations it is no longer there.
{Cleeve Comprehensive School}is situated along Two Hedges Road and caters for 1400 pupils who are taught by 78/84 teachers in 27 subjects. In 1965 the old Secondary Modern school was expanded for a non-selective intake. Its present catchment area includes Bishop's Cleeve,Woodmancote,Gotherington,Stoke Orchard,Prestbury,Lynworth and Swindon Village.The school has a very caring atmosphere enjoyed by everyone there.
